text: so what do you do with all those
overripe Tomatoes that are leaking out
on the counter you make tomato
vinaigrette
so blanch my green beans and my wax
beans and then I shock them immediately
in cold water to stop the cooking cuz
you want them nice and crisp just pull
them out you want to always start with
dry beans because if you've got wet
beans the vinaigrettes just gonna flop
to the bottom of the bowl and it's not
gonna be tasty so what you want to do is
find the reddest the Rye pused the
easiest tomato in your pile and use that
to make the vinaigrette because the
point of this recipe is to use the sweet
flesh that no longer has such a good
texture you want to cut the tomato
across the equator to expose the seeds
you don't want them in your vinaigrette
because they're too watery there's no
tool better to get the tomato water out
than your finger so just stick them
right in sounds like a kiss mwah love
you tomato aww and I don't have to worry
about grading off my fingers because the
tomato skin is gonna keep them safe so
now that I've got my tomato goop I'm
going to turn it into a vinaigrette by
adding vinegar I've got red wine vinegar
here and then salt and some minced
garlic it's gonna mix that all in get
all the garlic and then once you've got
that mixed then you drizzle in the oil
you always want to give the salt a
chance to dissolve a little bit before
you put the oil in because it's harder
for the salt to dissolve once you add
oil now this recipe is one that you
really need to just taste and make your
own amounts because every tomato is a
little bit different some are a little
more sweet summer have a little more
salt flavor so definitely taste it beans
go in the mixing bowl and then I'm gonna
add just enough of the vinaigrette to
coat them so you may not use all of it
see how much I need and the thing about
this is you really want to make this
salad ahead because it's gonna take a
while for the green beans to absorb at
the dressing olives or capers would work
anchovies would work and then that's it
and now I'm just gonna go outside and
get my basil
